FuncDef:
The traffic-policy command applies a traffic policy to a BD.
The undo traffic-policy command deletes a traffic policy from a BD. The traffic-policy command applies a traffic policy to a BD. The undo traffic-policy command deletes a traffic policy from a BD. By default, no traffic policy is applied to a BD. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a traffic policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Applies a traffic policy to the inbound direction of a BD.
-

Applies a traffic policy to the outbound direction of a BD.
-

ExtraInfo: Packets are classified based on Layer 2 information, Layer 3 information, or ACLs. To provide differentiated services for service flows, bind a traffic classifier and a traffic behavior to a traffic policy and apply the traffic policy. You can use the traffic-policy command to apply a traffic policy to a BD.
